summary: A dystopian story about a totalitarian society controlled by surveillance, propaganda, and thought police. Winston Smith, the protagonist, secretly rebels against the system in search of truth and freedom. Themes: totalitarianism, surveillance, freedom.

title: The Hobbit
summary: Bilbo Baggins, a comfort-loving hobbit, is swept into an adventure to reclaim a treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug. Along the way, he discovers courage and forms unexpected friendships. Themes: adventure, friendship, courage.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
summary: Harry discovers he is a wizard and attends Hogwarts, where he makes friends and faces the dark wizard Voldemort. Themes: magic, friendship, bravery.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
summary: Scout Finch grows up in a racially divided Southern town, learning about justice and empathy as her father defends a black man falsely accused of a crime. Themes: justice, empathy, racism.

title: The Lord of the Rings
summary: Frodo and his friends embark on a quest to destroy a powerful ring and save Middle-earth from darkness. Themes: good vs evil, friendship, sacrifice.

title: Pride and Prejudice
summary: Elizabeth Bennet navigates issues of manners, marriage, and morality in 19th-century England. Themes: love, social class, family.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
summary: Holden Caulfield recounts his experiences in New York City after being expelled from prep school, struggling with alienation and identity. Themes: alienation, identity, adolescence.

title: The Great Gatsby
summary: Jay Gatsby pursues wealth and love in 1920s America, only to face tragedy. Themes: love, wealth, the American Dream.

title: Animal Farm
summary: Farm animals overthrow their human owner, but the new regime becomes as oppressive as the old. Themes: power, corruption, revolution.

title: The Book Thief
summary: Liesel steals books and shares them during WWII in Nazi Germany, finding hope in words. Themes: war, hope, the power of words.
